title: Drawing, "Design for Frieze Decoration, with Alternative Suggestions", late 18th century
medium: Pen and brown ink, graphite, on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: In the center of an escutcheon, with the head of an animal on top. Festoons are supported by half-figures, seen at left from the right front, at right from left back.  At left a woman sits upon a scroll. At right a woman with a bowl kneels upon a leaf volute. The festoons are supported outside by rosettes.
